timeline.bodyText: ✏️  do we want any debug or trace logging here? Perhaps to log that we found and added cache sources to the properties?
timeline.author: rzwiefel

replies.bodyText: I was going back and forth on that just last night before pushing up the PR.  I backed off since I had changed so much already.  I can go back and see where it would not be possible to see a side effect from some other down range log statement.
replies.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: I added more logging.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ✏️ just double checking, was using the logger for SolrCacheSource.class intended?
timeline.author: rzwiefel

replies.bodyText: Whoops, copy and paste fail. 😅
replies.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: Fixed
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText:
You can ignore both of these, I was just checking into other ways to do this with optional/streaming to see how it looked but don't really strike me as advantageous. And that second one was just for POC, you can kinda curry args as you build up ctor parameters.. so while nifty.... having to specify the Function since it can't infer the type is not pretty at all  (neither is nested lambdas really) 😂
clonedResults
    .stream()
    .findFirst()
    .map(Result::getMetacard)
    .map(Metacard::getSourceId)
    .ifPresent(sourceId -> sourceResponse.getProcessingDetails()
        .stream()
        .map(sourceDetails -> new ProcessingDetailsImpl(sourceDetails, sourceId))
        .collect(Collectors.toSet()));
      clonedResults
        .stream()
        .findFirst()
        .map(Result::getMetacard)
        .map(Metacard::getSourceId)
        .map(
            sourceId ->
                (Function<SourceProcessingDetails, ProcessingDetailsImpl>)
                    sourceDetail -> new ProcessingDetailsImpl(sourceDetail, sourceId))
        .map(
            pdcreator ->
                response
                    .getProcessingDetails()
                    .stream()
                    .map(pdcreator)
                    .collect(Collectors.toSet()))
        .orElseGet(HashSet::new);
timeline.author: rzwiefel

timeline.message:
Extract Solr from Catalog Core

Extracted all Solr concerns out of catalog core.
Extracted Solr cache from federation strategy in standard catalog framework.
Solr cache is now a source and plugins.
Removed unused, outdated, alternative federation strategies.

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Making a note for later (might already be addressed) - should the cache separately support management commands with similar semantics so you can still work with it or verify behavior?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: If you need to query, you can use the current endpoints to query the new cache source.  Generally you should not have to manually manage the cache contents.  There are settings to manage when cached results age out.  If something makes it into the cache that needs to be immediately removed then there is still a cache clear command available.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Just so I'm understanding this correctly - pulling out the cache renders this mode property completely unnecessary now?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: This mode was only ever used by the old, removed Standard UI.  I removed it since there are no plans to use this feature in the future since it was too slow and did not scale well.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ This will never run against the cache, even if it happens to be installed, so filters are now fair game in all cases?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: Correct. This will only impact the catalog provider now.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Is this being reassigned? Can it be final instead?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: It is replaced with a mock during testing.  I added a @VisibleForTesting to its setter.
replies.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: ❓  Any reason it couldn't just get passed through the constructor instead? Does it need to change mid-test or would re-building the object before each test be unnecessarily verbose?
replies.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: Nope.  Looks like it is only used in the setup method.  I think I was just trying to avoid anything that would impact blueprint but it appears this will only impact the test.  I can fix this one.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ I'm a tad confused why we need finalSourceQueryRequest, is it because of side effects? If so do we need to copy sourceQueryRequest instead of just assigning? Or was this done just for readability?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: I think the new lambda could not access that local variable since it was not effectively final due to the PreFederatedQueryPlugins could change the reference of that variable.  finalSourceQueryRequest is effectively final since it is never modified for the rest of its scope.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Are both this federateStrategy and the above strategy necessary? They seem like dupes. Are they stateful and are you comparing state? Seems like they were made for different tests but it's not clear what the difference is.
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: ❓ Any word on this ☝️  question?
replies.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: Looks like the difference was only needed for one test.  I will push that mock and different strategy down to that one test.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: Most plugins make this assumption today.  I left this the way it was without adding more defensive checks but I did go back and forth on it.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Is it worth making these final by removing the setters and doing constructor injection instead?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: Doesn't look like this impacts Blueprint or tests so I will go ahead and fix it.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Do we need null checks for any of these things in the ctor?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: We are inconsistent on if we null check things that we construct and inject from Blueprint.  I think SolrCacheSource is the only class that had constructor validation that came over from the original code.
replies.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: Adding more ctor null checks.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: ❓ If we don't make them final do we need to null check in the setters or here?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: The setter is package private for testing.  I added @VisibleForTesting to the setter.
replies.author: pklinef

replies.bodyText: ❓  Should we null check in the setter, then? If the shutdown() method gets called and we get an NPE the stack trace we analyze won't have anything to do with the actual bug.
replies.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: This is now OBE based on other changes to a previous comment.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: 👍   I think seeing this addresses one of my earlier questions.
timeline.author: Lambeaux

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Do we have any other E2E tests for the cache? Can we run them independently now?
timeline.author: Lambeaux

replies.bodyText: I think we used to have E2E tests for the Standard UI and the cache.  I think this was just left over.  You should be able to test this independently now.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.author: lamhuy

replies.bodyText: Good catch.  This is no longer needed now that we do not support the index mode used by the old, removed Standard UI.  I will remove it.
replies.author: pklinef

timeline.bodyText: is this class being used anymore?
timeline.author: lamhuy

replies.bodyText:
Looks like it gets statically set on the CacheStrategy.

  
    
      ddf/catalog/core/catalog-core-standardframework/src/main/java/ddf/catalog/cache/solr/impl/LocalCatalogIdSupplier.java
    
    
         Line 25
      in
      b054ac2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           CacheStrategy.setLocalSourceIdSupplier(this);
replies.author: pklinef
